summary: This bill, the State-Level Departments of Government Efficiency Establishment Act, mandates that states establish departments to review the efficiency of their administration of federal funds, aiming to eliminate waste, fraud, and abuse.  States must have these "DOGE" agencies to continue receiving discretionary federal appropriations, starting in fiscal year 2026. These agencies must have bipartisan representation, with annual reports published and submitted to a federal department. The bill defines "State" broadly.
